item.title: Teleporting
item.dc:creator: @sjustin1996 sjustin1996
item.description:
@sjustin1996 wrote:

That would be edited in the server files. You would want to search for your current coordinates before anything. You can find these by teleporting there, and looking at your server files, or more accessible:

If (command.equalsIgnoreCase("getcoords")) { { sendMessage("X: " + absX + " Y: " + absY); }

And change that “sendMessage” part according to what yours is, I.E. “sM(”");"

Once you find your current coordinates, move to your target location, and type that command, or go to your character files after logging out, and then replace the old coordinates with your new coordinates. You may also want to edit the name of the teleport, which, if not found in client files, can be edited through your server, most likely in the TextHandler class.

EDIT: I would reccomend the command, as it is much more accessible, and will most likely be useful in the future as well as the present.

EDIT2: Also, if you have no TextHandler class, try using the “search” textbox in the upper right hand corner of your windows explorer (assuming you’re using windows) and then search for the whatever you need to find, and if your search is set up to do so, you will find any files that contain the content of your query.

Read full topic

such as from vorrock to fally?

Read full topic

item.title: Teleporting
item.dc:creator: @sjustin1996 sjustin1996
item.description:
@sjustin1996 wrote:

If it’s a 317, and your teleports have interface menus, then you would edit the names of them in Class9.java

EDIT: For example, mine has the options for crabs, dags, the island, cave, and slayer npcs. You would search for “Rock Crabs” in my case, and edit that to, (once again, in my case) Rare Items. (If you want an explanation for that, I made rock crabs have !@#$loads of health and level 400 and made them drop full arma, full elite armor, and 50M.)

Read full topic
